RemoteHook#

class RemoteHook(inner_train_update: bool = True, inner_eval_update: bool = False, *, as_prehook: bool = False, prepend: bool = False, always_call: bool = False)[source]#

Bases: Hook, ABC

Interactable hook which acts on the state of inner modules.

Unlike a StateHook, this acts not on the registered module but on added “inner modules”. Subclass this for cases where the triggering event for a hook should be a module other than the one on which the hook should be evaluated.

Parameters:

  • inner_train_update (bool, optional) – if the hook should be run on the inner module when the inner module is in training mode. Defaults to True.

  • inner_eval_update (bool, optional) – if the hook should be run on the inner module when the inner module is in evaluation mode. Defaults to False.

  • as_prehook (bool, optional) – if the hook should be run prior to the hooked module’s forward() call. Defaults to False.

  • prepend (bool, optional) – if the hook should be run prior to the hooked module’s previously registered forward hooks. Defaults to False.

  • always_call (bool, optional) – if the hook should be run even if an exception occurs, only applies when as_prehook is False. Defaults to False.

Note

By default, the hook will be triggered on the the registered module’s call whether its in training or evaluation mode (since generally this should be controlled by the inner_train_update and inner_eval_update arguments). The same properties as in StateHook can be used to alter this.

add_inner(modules: Module | tuple[Module, ...], *args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → None[source]#

Adds inner modules to the hook.

Parameters:

  • modules (Module | tuple[Module, ...]) – inner module(s) to add.

  • *args (Any) – positional arguments which will be passed to the inner hook for the modules added in this call.

  • **kwargs (Any) – keyword arguments which will be passed to the inner hook for the modules added in this call.

Note

The positional and keyword arguments are shared amongst all of the modules added in this call, but not amongst all added modules. If different arguments are required for different inner modules, add in multiple calls.

abstract innerhook(module: Module, *args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → None[source]#

Function to be called on the inner modules when the registered module is called.

  • *args (Any) – positional arguments given with the inner module.

  • **kwargs (Any) – keyword arguments given with the inner module.

NotImplementedError – innerhook must be implemented by the subclass.

remove_inner(modules: Module | tuple[Module, ...]) → None[source]#

Removes inner modules from the hook.

run(force: bool = False) → None[source]#

Executes the hook at any time, by default only when registered.

Parameters:

force (bool, optional) – run the hook even if it is unregistered. Defaults to False.

Note

Whether or not it is registered to a module, this will not respect if it is in training or evaluation mode (only relevant if manually configured).
